key_responsibilities: managing the Member’s schedule
making travel arrangements
handling miscellaneous administrative tasks
requirements: ability to work well as an individual and as a member of a team

key_responsibilities: Answering telephones
assisting with the Committee investigation’s production process
assisting with the tracking and processing of Committee correspondence
providing administrative support in setting up Committee meetings
entering data and navigating databases with accuracy
requirements: proficiency in Microsoft Word and Excel
ability to work cooperatively and courteously with others
ability to use good judgment in responding to inquiries and requests
flexibility in assisting with daily tasks and projects

key_responsibilities: serving as a senior manager
serving as the Member's point of contact with interest and advocacy groups
coordinating with legislative team to proactively identify outreach opportunities
staffing the Member in select meetings
working with Chief of Staff and Legislative Director to strategically identify legislative and policy opportunities
requirements: extensive experience working with interest groups on or off Capitol Hill

key_responsibilities: managing high volume incoming constituent correspondence
providing research for and responses to constituent correspondence
requirements: ability to work in a fast-paced environment
Intranet Quorum and Capitol Hill experience

key_responsibilities: staffing front office and greeting visitors
answering phones
coordinating and executing flag and tour requests
supervising interns
assisting with mail processing
helping with other projects as needed
requirements: Previous Capitol Hill or internship experience

key_responsibilities: structuring and managing the Member’s daily schedule
coordinating the Member’s travel and logistical details of meetings
handling the Member’s personal correspondence
fulfilling various administrative duties including ethics/disclosure compliance
working closely with other staff members in the district and in DC
ensuring smooth overall office operations
requirements: strong oral and written communication skills
ability to thrive in a fast paced environment
poise, patience and a good sense of humor
ability to successfully interact with different personality types

key_responsibilities: overseeing all district operations
supervision of special projects
working with casework staff
representing the member at a variety of different civic engagements
managing district office operations
working with the chief of staff and the Member to develop and implement policy objectives
planning, assigning and evaluating work of employees in district offices
speaking to local groups when the Member is unavailable
maintaining close communications with the Member, the Washington office and committee staff
traveling throughout the district to keep abreast of local concerns
meeting with elected officials and representatives of local groups
scheduling meetings with federal and district government agencies
responding to constituent telephone calls and mail
performing other duties as assigned
requirements: ability to provide necessary organization, leadership and motivation to manage a House office
excellent oral and written communication skills
thorough knowledge of legislative process and of House organization and procedures
significant community involvement throughout the Congressional District in Fort Worth

key_responsibilities: reviewing and providing guidance on a high volume of financial disclosure issues
education and training to Members of Congress and their staff
requirements: outstanding analytical and written and oral communication skills
Experience in government ethics, ethics counseling, corporate finance, securities law, and criminal law

key_responsibilities: conducting investigations and adjudicatory and disciplinary proceedings regarding Members and staff of the U.S. House of Representatives
requirements: outstanding analytical and written/oral communications skills
Experience in government ethics, criminal law, civil litigation, administrative investigations and adjudications, depositions, and financial accounting
